title: (closed) PyTorch 0.1.12 version has different Math APIs (e.g. sum, max) in different OS
body_html:
I used PyTorch 0.1.12 version.

What I found is Math API in PyTorch(0.1.12) installed in Linux, MacOS, windows is different.

I printed PyTorch version information by using "print(torch.version)

MacOS version : 0.1.12 (conda install pytorch torchvision -c soumith)
Windows version : 0.1.12 (conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch=0.1.12)
Linux version: 0.1.12_2

When I used math API such as sum and max, I found some version(MacOS) has argument options (keepdim) and others(Windows, Linux) has not.

As a result, the output dimension of mat API operation is different.

Please check the issue :)

As a result, the output dimension of mat API operation is different.
Please check the issue :)
body:
I used PyTorch 0.1.12 version. 

What I found is Math API in PyTorch(0.1.12) installed in Linux, MacOS, windows  is different.

I printed PyTorch version information by using "print(torch.__version__)

MacOS version : 0.1.12 (conda install pytorch torchvision -c soumith)
Windows version : 0.1.12 (conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch=0.1.12)
Linux version: 0.1.12_2

When I used math API such as sum and max, I found some version(MacOS) has argument options (keepdim) and others(Windows, Linux) has not.

As a result, the output dimension of mat API operation is different. 

Please check the issue :)
